data-upload.title: Upload CSV Data
data-upload.text: CSV format: Header row, numeric columns for PCA. Non-numeric auto-excluded. Add #target suffix for target variables.

choose-file.title: Choose CSV File
choose-file.text: Required: CSV with header row. Numeric data in columns. Optional: row names in first column, #target suffix for targets.

sample-datasets.title: Sample Datasets
sample-datasets.text: Try PCA with built-in datasets: Corn NIR (spectroscopy), Iris (classic ML), or Wine (chemometrics).

sample-dataset-corn.title: Corn (NIR) Dataset
sample-dataset-corn.text: Near infrared spectra on 80 corn samples including reference measurements for Moisture, Oil, Protein, and Starch.

sample-dataset-iris.title: Iris Dataset
sample-dataset-iris.text: Classic multivariate dataset that contains measurements of sepal and petal length and width for three species of iris flowers.

sample-dataset-swiss-roll.title: Swiss Roll Dataset
sample-dataset-swiss-roll.text: Synthetic 3D dataset with 1,000 samples where data points form a rolled-up two-dimensional surface, often used to demonstrate nonlinear dimensionality reduction.

sample-dataset-wine.title: Wine Dataset
sample-dataset-wine.text: Dataset containing chemical analysis results of wines from three cultivars, widely used for classification and feature analysis tasks.

gocsv-integration.title: GoCSV Data Editor
gocsv-integration.text: GoCSV is a companion app for data preparation. Click to install GoCSV if not available, and open your data file in GoCSV for editing and cleaning.

num-components.title: Number of Components
num-components.text: Principal components to extract. Default: 2. Max meaningful: min(n-1, p). Use 2-3 for visualization, more for full variance.

pca-method.title: PCA Method
pca-method.text: SVD: Fast, exact for complete data. NIPALS: Handles missing data, iterative. Kernel: Non-linear relationships.

kernel-type.title: Kernel Type
kernel-type.text: RBF: General nonlinear, most versatile. Linear: Equivalent to standard PCA. Polynomial: Degree-n relationships.

kernel-gamma.title: Gamma Parameter
kernel-gamma.text: RBF bandwidth. Small (0.001-0.01): smooth patterns. Large (0.1-10): local patterns. Default: 1/n_features.

kernel-degree.title: Polynomial Degree
kernel-degree.text: Polynomial degree. 2=quadratic, 3=cubic. Higher captures more complex relationships but risks overfitting.

kernel-coef0.title: Polynomial Coefficient
kernel-coef0.text: Independent term in polynomial kernel. Usually 0 or 1.

row-preprocessing.title: Row-wise Preprocessing
row-preprocessing.text: Per-sample transforms. SNV: spectroscopic scatter correction. L2: unit vector normalization.

snv.title: Standard Normal Variate
snv.text: Removes multiplicative scatter in spectroscopy. Centers and scales each sample independently.

l2-norm.title: L2 Normalization
l2-norm.text: Normalize samples to unit Euclidean length. Makes all samples equidistant from origin.

column-preprocessing.title: Column-wise Preprocessing
column-preprocessing.text: Applied per feature: Mean center (required for PCA), scale for equal feature importance.

mean-center.title: Mean Center Only
mean-center.text: Subtracts column mean. Essential for PCA to find principal axes through data center.

standard-scale.title: Standard Scale
standard-scale.text: Centers and divides by std dev. Essential when variables have different units or scales.

robust-scale.title: Robust Scale
robust-scale.text: Median/MAD scaling. Robust to outliers. Use when data contains anomalies.

variance-scale.title: Variance Scale
variance-scale.text: Divides by std dev only (no centering). Rarely used, preserves zero baseline.

missing-strategy.title: Missing Data Strategy
missing-strategy.text: Drop: Remove incomplete rows. Mean: Impute with column average. Native: NIPALS handles missing values directly without imputation (NIPALS only).

explained-variance.title: Explained Variance
explained-variance.text: Percentage of total data variance captured by each component. Higher = more information retained. Cumulative 70-90% typical.

scores-plot.title: Scores Plot
scores-plot.text: Shows samples in PC space. Similar samples cluster together. Look for groups and outliers.

scree-plot.title: Scree Plot
scree-plot.text: Eigenvalues vs PC number. Elbow point indicates optimal components. Check cumulative % variance.

loadings-plot.title: Loadings Plot
loadings-plot.text: Shows feature contributions. Features far from origin contribute most to selected PCs. Not available for Kernel PCA.

biplot-plot.title: Biplot
biplot-plot.text: Combines scores and loadings. See sample-feature relationships. Arrows show feature influence. Not available for Kernel PCA.

correlations-plot.title: Circle of Correlations
correlations-plot.text: Feature correlations with PCs. Vectors near circle edge = well-represented features.

biplot.title: Biplot
biplot.text: Combines scores and loadings. See sample-feature relationships. Arrows show feature influence. Not available for Kernel PCA.

circle-correlations.title: Circle of Correlations
circle-correlations.text: Feature correlations with PCs. Vectors near circle edge = well-represented features. Not available for Kernel PCA.

diagnostics-plot.title: Diagnostics Plot
diagnostics-plot.text: T² vs Q residuals. Upper-right points are potential outliers. Not available for Kernel PCA.

eigencorrelation-plot.title: Eigencorrelation Plot
eigencorrelation-plot.text: Heatmap showing correlations between PC scores and metadata variables. Helps identify relationships between components and external factors like batch effects or biological conditions.

component-selector.title: Component Selection
component-selector.text: Choose which PCs to plot. PC1 usually most important. Try different combinations.

group-coloring.title: Color by Group
group-coloring.text: Color points by categorical column. Reveals group separation in PC space.

confidence-ellipses.title: Confidence Ellipses
confidence-ellipses.text: Statistical regions containing specified % of group points. Assumes normal distribution.

export-plot.title: Export Plot
export-plot.text: Save as PNG (raster) or SVG (vector). SVG better for publications.

zoom-controls.title: Zoom Controls
zoom-controls.text: Zoom in/out, reset view, or fullscreen. Drag to pan when zoomed.

data-selection.title: Data Selection
data-selection.text: Click rows/columns to exclude from analysis. Useful for outlier investigation.

theme-toggle.title: Theme Toggle
theme-toggle.text: Switch between light and dark modes. Preference saved locally.

plot-color-palette.title: Plot Palettes
plot-color-palette.text: Choose between Categorical (distinct colors for groups/categories) or Sequential (gradient for continuous values).

cli-command-preview.title: CLI Command Preview
cli-command-preview.text: Shows you how to run the same analysis using the pca command-line tool. Copy the command to use it in your terminal or scripts.

preprocessing-order.title: Preprocessing Order
preprocessing-order.text: Row-wise (SNV/L2) applied first, then column-wise (centering/scaling). Order matters!

outlier-detection.title: Outlier Detection
outlier-detection.text: High T²: unusual but follows model. High Q: doesn't fit model. Both high: strong outlier.

row-labels.title: Row Labels
row-labels.text: Display sample IDs on plots. First column if non-numeric, else row numbers. Useful for identifying specific points.

diagnostic-metrics.title: Calculate Diagnostic Metrics
diagnostic-metrics.text: Compute T² (Hotelling) and Q (SPE) residuals for outlier detection. Not available for Kernel PCA.

export-model.title: Export PCA Model
export-model.text: Save trained model as JSON for later use with 'pca transform' CLI command or for archival. Export includes only relevant parameters for the method used (kernel parameters only for Kernel PCA).

go-pca-button.title: Run PCA Analysis
go-pca-button.text: Execute PCA with current settings. Results appear in Step 3. Re-run anytime to update with new parameters.

copy-command.title: Copy CLI Command
copy-command.text: Copy equivalent pca CLI command to clipboard for automation or scripting.

palette-selector.title: Color Palette
palette-selector.text: Choose colors for plot. Categorical: distinct colors for groups. Sequential: gradient for continuous values.

plot-tabs.title: Plot Type Selection
plot-tabs.text: Switch between plot types. Scores: samples. Loadings: variables. Scree: variance. Biplot: combined view.

clear-data.title: Clear Data
clear-data.text: Remove current dataset and reset to initial state. All analysis results will be cleared.

exclude-columns.title: Exclude Columns
exclude-columns.text: Select columns to exclude from PCA. Useful for removing ID columns or problematic variables.

exclude-rows.title: Exclude Rows
exclude-rows.text: Select rows to exclude from PCA. Useful for removing outliers or problematic samples.
